The 1988 season was a memorable one for the Dodgers as a squad that was picked
to finish fourth wound up winning the World Series, beating the heavily favored
New York Mets and Oakland Athletics on the way. Kirk Gibson carried the Dodger
offense, winning the National League Most Valuable Player Award. Orel Hershiser
dominated on the mound, throwing a record 59 consecutive scoreless innings on
his way to winning the Cy Young Award.
categories: 1988 Major League Baseball season|Los Angeles Dodgers
